author: T Madhavan
text:
Following allegations of bogus voters being included in the recently released voters list, Election Commission officials carried out surprise checks in Tambaram Assembly constituency on Tuesday.

Election Commission of India principal secretary R.K. Srivatsava and Joint Chief Electoral Officer of Tamil Nadu State Election Commission A. Sivagnanam conducted a door-to-door verification of the voters’ list in Kovilanchery and Madurapakkam villages under Tambaram Assembly constituency.

Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam’s district functionary Velmurugan had filed a complaint with district revenue officials stating that 200 bogus names were included in the list by the ruling All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam party workers with the help of the enumeration staff at Tambaram.

The team members had found that a few voters could not be located at the specified addresses, for which they sought an explanation from the village administrative officer and booth official.

After completing their verification process, Mr. Srivatsava told reporters that the checking process would continue for the next few days.

District officials would submit a report to the State Election Commissioner on this issue soon and an action taken report would be forwarded to the Chief Election Commissioner in New Delhi, he said.

Police pickets

Supporters of ruling AIADMK and DMK gathered in large numbers as they were curious about the inspection.

Anticipating a clash, a large number of police personnel were posted.

Following claims of bogus voters in the list, a verification exercise was held in Tambaram
title: EC conducts surprise checks
